item.title: Psycho-Educational Testing
item.description: Children with academic difficulties, such as subject comprehension, learning retention and poor reading, spelling, written expression and math skills can benefit from psycho-educational testing. After establishing a rapport with the child to put them at ease, we test their abstract reasoning, problem solving skills, memory and attention span, critical thinking and other areas that influence academic achievement.

item.title: Neurodevelopmental Assessments
item.description: We assess the childâ€™s development in the areas of communication, gross and fine motor function, cognition and learning, play, socio-emotional and self-help skills. We also assess the functioning of the brain, spinal cord, nerves and muscles, and review their hearing and vision reports. For school-going children with behaviour and learning concerns, we go over their schoolwork, a report from their teachers, and may visit the school to observe the child at work and play.
